page.title: 04GASCOIGNE WOOD COAL MINE 3.
page.content: The two tunnels are called the North Drift and the South Drift each are 1.1 kilometre at their deepest points.A conveyor belt runs down each of them at a speed of 20mph.They are 30kms (18miles)long.The tunnels are lit by flourescent lighting unless they are in a new tunnel or at a coal face then they use their helmet lamps.They have more than enough office staff but in the future they hope to have only 20 because computers will do most of the work even loading the trains.Accidents are very scarce underground because miners are rarely on their own and what's more their are telephones connected to the offices every 100metres.When the miners' strike of 1984 was on work stopped completely ,but in October 1984 miners began drifting back and work began once more.
